DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether an assessment for metastatic disease was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the assessment for metastatic disease, metastasis is the spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/17/17 tt transferred context and added registration status, CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not evaluable Not applicable Indeterminate Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent a number of conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/17/17 tt transferred context and added registration status, CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient free of all metastatic disease (by chemotherapy or by surgery)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Follow-Up Disease Evaluation
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was development of metastatic disease observed at this evaluation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have metastatic disease limited to the CNS?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pathologic, clinical, or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease outside the brain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have definitive evidence of bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had bone metastases, has a CT scan of diagnostic quality been performed to assess response?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pathologic, clinical, or radiologic evidence of overt metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have evidence of metastatic lung disease at time of initial diagnosis, or at time of 1st recurrence following completion of therapy for initially localized?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of metastatic lung disease at time of initial diagnosis, or at time of 1st recurrence following completion of therapy for initially localized?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there radiographic evidence of overt metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have radiographic evidence of overt metastatic disease within 28 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have radiographic evidence of overt metastatic disease within 45 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have radiographic evidence of overt metastatic disease within 45 days prior to Step 1/Study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of metastatic lung disease at time of initial diagnosis, or at time of 1st recurrence following completion of therapy for initially localized disease?
